newsitem.title: UK: Stable prices stimulate cotton buying in Europe.
newsitem.headline: Stable prices stimulate cotton buying in Europe.

text.p: Steady asking rates for almost all upland descriptions of raw cotton stimulated renewed buying in Germany, France and Belgium, industry sources reported on Thursday.
Central Asian medium and better qualities were the focus of attention although Portugal saw a leisurely interest in West African descriptions, they said.
Sources in Eastern Europe reported some limited demand for selected long staple varieties but the volume of raw cotton trade was said to be low. --London Newsroom, +44 171 542 8071
